meanings.definition: Lemmatizing: The process of reducing words to their base or root form.
meanings.sent1: Lemmatizing helps us understand the basic form of words.
meanings.sent2: The lemmatizing of words makes it easier to study language.
meanings.sent3: I find it amusing how lemmatizing simplifies complex words.
meanings.sent4: The lemmatizing process peels away layers to reveal the word's core.
meanings.sent5: Through lemmatizing, words become like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.

meanings.definition: Lemmatizing: To group together the inflected forms of a word so they can be analyzed as a single item.
meanings.sent1: When lemmatizing, we combine different forms of a word for analysis.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use lemmatizing to study word variations more efficiently.
meanings.sent3: I lemmatize words like a detective solving a mystery.
meanings.sent4: Lemmatizing is like gathering scattered pieces to form a complete picture.
meanings.sent5: Through lemmatizing, words unite to reveal their true essence.
